intro: Disporum smilacinum var. album, commonly known as the white-flowered disporum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are often visited by pollinators like bees and butterflies. The varietal name 'album' refers to its distinctive white bloom, setting it apart from other varieties of the species.
